performers

Class Monster

  • Object
    • performers.Monster
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Blob, Rat

    public abstract class Monster
extends Object
    A superclass for all of our monsters in the game. An abstract class cannot be initialized, so initialize subclasses of it instead. For subclasses, we are forced to write the code of the abstract methods. For regular methods in the superclass, we get to use these in any subclass, without having to write them in the subclasses again and again.

      • hitPoints

        protected int hitPoints

      • strength

        protected int strength

    • Constructor Detail

      • Monster

        public Monster(int hitPoints,
               int strength)
        Every monster should have hit points, and some strength. But, this is really up to your own design, and you can change these to keep track of different data that is common to all your monsters.
        Parameters:
        hitPoints - An amount of damage a monster must have removed before dying.
        strength - An amount of physical ability a moster has.

    • Method Detail

      • damageHitPoints

        public void damageHitPoints(int damage)
        Decreases hit points of this montser.
        Parameters:
        damage - The amount of damage this monster will receive to reduce its hit points.

      • getHitPoints

        public int getHitPoints()
        Returns the hit points of this monster.
        Returns:
        The hit points of this monster.

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Checks whether this montser is dead or still alive.
        Returns:
        A value of true if this monster has no hit points, and false otherwise.

      • attack

        public abstract String[] attack(Player plyr)
        Each subclass monster should have a unique attack.
        Parameters:
        plyr - Access to the player instance so you can control it from inside a monster.
        Returns:
        An array of strings, describing the results of this monster attack on the player.

      • castSpell

        public abstract String[] castSpell(Player plyr)
        Each subclass monster should have a unique spell to cast.
        Parameters:
        plyr - Access to the player instance so you can control it from inside a monster.
        Returns:
        An array of strings, describing the results of this monster spell on the player.

      • getDescription

        public abstract String getDescription()
        Get a description of the kind of subclass of this monster.
        Returns:
        The kind of subclass of this monster in the form of a description in the context of the story.
